snippet: The killing this week of Al Qaeda’s deputy head, Abu Yahya al-Libi, tore at the tissue between the group’s leadership and affiliates in the Middle East and Africa.
abstract: Killing of Al Qaeda’s deputy leader Abu Yahya al-Libi is likely to accelerate a shift in power from the group’s dwindling leadership in Pakistan to its increasingly autonomous franchises, particularly the branch in Yemen; analysts say Libi's death may even augur increased violence as younger, more impetuous fighters vie to seize the mantle of global leadership.
lead_paragraph: The killing this week of Al Qaeda’s deputy head, Abu Yahya al-Libi, tore at the tissue between the group’s leadership and affiliates in the Middle East and Africa.

headline.seo: Al Qaeda Power Shifting Away From Pakistan
headline.main: As Al Qaeda Loses a Leader, Its Power Shifts From Pakistan
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Deaths Shift Power in Terrorism Network
